qas.question: During which period did Jacksonville become a popular destination for the rich?
Which US President visited Jacksonville in 1888?
What caused Jacksonville's tourism to become less desirable at the latter half of the 19th century?
What drew would-be Jacksonville tourists to other Florida destinations?

answers.text: extension of the Florida East Coast Railway further south

qas.question: Other than the steamboat, what modern form of travel brought visitors to Florida?
During what age was Jacksonville no longer a popular destination for the rich?
What caused Jacksonville tourism to be less desirable during the 1900s?

plausible_answers.text: extension of the Florida East Coast Railway further south

qas.question: Extensions of what drew Taurus to Jacksonville?
What modern forms of travel took visitors to other parts of Florida?

context: During <a0_1><a0_2>Reconstruction<a0_1/> and the <a0_0><b5_0>Gilded Age<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_0/>, Jacksonville and nearby St. Augustine became popular winter resorts for the rich and famous. Visitors arrived by <b9_0>steamboat and later by <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>railroad<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>. <a1_2>President <a1_0><a1_1><b6_0>Grover Cleveland<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> attended the Sub-Tropical Exposition in the city on February 22, 1888 during his trip to Florida. This highlighted the visibility of the state as a worthy place for tourism. The city's tourism, however, was dealt major blows in the late 19th century by <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>yellow fever outbreaks<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>. In addition, <a3_0><b8_0>extension of <a3_2>the <a3_1>Florida East Coast Railway<a3_2/><a3_1/> further south<b8_0/><a3_0/> drew visitors to other areas. From 1893 to 1938 Jacksonville was the site of the Florida Old Confederate Soldiers and Sailors Home with a nearby cemetery.
